title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8200-3.1 - Classification of track
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8200-3.1 - Classification of track

State Regulations
(a) For
purposes of determining railroad ceilings pursuant to this Part, track shall be
classified as follows: (1)

Category I high
speed/high tonnage track shall include all passenger and/or freight main track
capable of more than 60 mph and related sidetrack. (2)

Category II medium speed/high tonnage
track shall include all passenger and/or freight main track capable of at least
40 mph but no more than 60 mph and related sidetrack and electronic
classification yards. (3)

Category
III low speed/medium tonnage track shall include freight main track capable at
least 10 mph but no more than 39 mph and related sidetrack. (4)

Category IV low speed/low tonnage track
shall include freight main track capable of no more than 9 mph, related
sidetrack. (b) ORPTS
shall establish procedures for the calculation of railroad ceilings for each
year's assessment rolls. These procedures shall provide for the depreciation of
track. This depreciation may be the same for more than one class of track and
may be a single percentage good for all track in a class. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8200-3.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
